title: Horsted Keynes Walks

images.title: nick macneill, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The village green. There is a grocery shop to the right of the picture and a pub further down the road. There was a pub to the left of the photo, but this now seems to be in the process of being converted to flats.

images.title: Peter Trimming / Waiting for the Train at Horsted Keynes
images.caption: Waiting for the Train. This impressive array of signals shows how important this was as a country junction when rail travel was at its peak. Horsted Keynes is, perhaps, the most interesting station on the Bluebell Railway.

images.title: Lake by the path to Horsted Keynes by N Chadwick, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Lake by the path to Horsted Keynes

images.title: The Green Man, Horsted Keynes by N Chadwick, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Green Man pub.

images.title: Kevin Gordon / The Old Rectory, Horsted Keynes
images.caption: The Old Rectory. A beautiful house viewed from St Giles Church. Note the gazebo on the right.

images.title: Peter Trimming / Bluebell Railway North of Horsted Keynes
images.caption: Bluebell Railway. At this point, the footpath runs to the side of the railway line, on an embankment.

images.title: Dave Spicer / Sussex Border Path and private road to Broadhurst Manor
images.caption: Sussex Border Path and private road to Broadhurst Manor

images.title: Sheep grazing by Piplye Wood by N Chadwick, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Sheep grazing by Piplye Wood

description: This pretty West Sussex village has some good walking country trails and a couple of fine old pubs for post exercise refreshment. There is also a historic church dating from the Norman period. The Grade I listed church is notable as the burial place of Harold Macmillan, ex-prime minster of Britain. This circular walk explores the countryside and woods to the north of the village. You'll visit a number of local fishing lakes before heading over to see the Horsted Keynes railway station on the old Bluebell Railway. The walk starts at the public car park in the village centre where you can pick up the Sussex Border Path and follow the waymarked trail north to Broadhurst Manor, passing a series of fishing lakes on the way. The route bends round to the west at Tanyard before heading south to Cinder Hill and then along the railway line to the old station on the heritage steam railway. You then pass Leamland Wood and Pain's Wood before returning to the village centre.
